summary: This document is an email chain from July 2020 regarding the custody arrangements for Ghislaine Maxwell at the Merrimack County Department of Corrections in New Hampshire. It discusses adding her New York attorneys to her approved contact list and outlines strict security protocols for her detention.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the custody and security arrangements. She is to be housed in a medical unit under strict observation and is authorized to communicate only with her legal counsel.

persons.name: Lawrence Vogelman
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, initially the only authorized legal contact listed for her while in custody at Merrimack DOC.

persons.name: Chris Everdell
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender requests be added to the approved list of people she can speak with on the phone.

persons.name: Mark Cohen
persons.context: One of Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys whom the email sender requests be added to the approved list of people she can speak with on the phone.

connections.description: Vogelman is authorized as Maxwell's legal counsel for contact while she is in custody.
Everdell is identified as one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom her representatives are seeking to add to her approved contact list.
Cohen is identified as one of Maxwell's New York attorneys whom her representatives are seeking to add to her approved contact list.

events.title: Custody Restrictions Issued for Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Marshals Service issues strict directives for Ghislaine Maxwell's custody at Merrimack DOC, including housing in a medical unit, 15-minute observation watches, and restricted communication.

events.title: Request to Add Attorneys to Contact List
events.description: A request is made via email to add Ghislaine Maxwell's New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen, to her approved phone contact list to facilitate case discussions.

locations: Merrimack County Department of Corrections (Merrimack DOC), New Hampshire
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was in custody at the Merrimack County Department of Corrections in New Hampshire in July 2020 under extremely high-security protocols.
Security directives included housing her in a medical unit, posting SRT personnel, a 15-minute observation watch, and a prohibition on staff conversing with her outside of health and safety needs.
Initially, only attorney Lawrence Vogelman was on her approved legal contact list, but her representatives requested adding her New York attorneys, Chris Everdell and Mark Cohen.
The U.S. Marshals Service strictly controlled all information, warning staff not to make statements to the press.
The document reflects the immediate logistical and security concerns following Maxwell's arrest.
